intro: Erigeron hieraciifolius, commonly known as the yarrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Erigeron hieraciifolius is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
